condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Improved social accountability systems in place for WASH sector services

description.narrative: UNICEF was instrumental in re-instating the national level sector coordination meeting through the re-establishment of the Water and Sanitation Sector Working Group (SWG) meeting, now chaired by honorable Minister for Sanitation and Water Resources. “Golden Indicators” were updated and endorsed by the SWG for sector performance tracking at the national level. Through strategic partnerships key sector issues such as, the need for additional budgetary allocation to the WASH sector, the proposed establishment of a National Sanitation Authority and the need for an enhanced focus in WASH in Healthcare Facilities were raised for dialogue with government. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:26/12/2019

title.narrative: Annual Sector Performance Report is completed with input from Civil Society

actual.value: 2020:A draft combined sector performance report which highlights WASH sector activities within 2018/2019 year has been developed for sector validation.
2020:The Ministry of Sanitation and Water Resources taking the lead role in the implementation of the sustainability check activity with a pilot to begin this year.
